abstract: The mechanism is meant to prevent wild gyrations like the one that sent the Dow down more than 600 points in a few minutes last May.
snippet: The mechanism is meant to prevent wild gyrations like the one that sent the Dow down more than 600 points in a few minutes last May.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Securities and Exchange Commission said on Tuesday that it would consider limits on the amount by which a stock’s price can move in any five-minute period, a fixture that would replace the single-stock circuit breakers installed after the so-called flash crash volatility on May 6, 2010.

headline.main: S.E.C. Weighs Trading Limits to Avert Extreme Volatility
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. to Weigh Trading Limits to Avert Extreme Volatility
